line: Let's get you up.
But if I finish the ritual you started, I'll never have to fear anyone, ever.
I am so much more than what you made me.
I need your eyes. In a manner of speaking.
Use the parasite - link your mind to mine. Through your eyes, I can see the scars on my back and copy them onto his.
Yes. Yes, I see it!
There. Perfect.
Time to take your place.
Ecce dominus!
Has animas offero in sacrificio...
Nunc volo potestatem quam pollicitus es mihi...
I... I can't feel it. That ache in my stomach, that hunger - it's gone.
Come on, let's get out of here. I have a brand new world to explore.
[Panting]
Yes, it's over. You can do whatever you want.
As for those wretches in the cells - if I don't get my freedom, neither do they.
It's over. I'm done with this and I'm done with you.
I would say good luck out there, but honestly? I hope you die screaming.
One last thrust and I'll be free of you. I'll never have to fear you again.
I'm not the one in the dirt.
Doors can be unsealed. Do you have the key?
Things have changed, Godey. We might surprise you.
I don't even know what this prison is. He hid all of this from me and the others.
If I had to guess, I'd say they're part of his ritual. But where in the hells did they come from?
I'm just surprised to see such wretched-looking specimens - Cazador had a more refined palate than this.
It's taking everything I have not to grind your rotten carcass to dust.
You tortured us. For days at a time.
We're here to see the master, but the ballroom door's locked. Give us the key.
I was hoping you'd say that. Taking it from the ruins of your corpse will be more satisfying anyway.
Isn't it obvious? I'm going to kill Cazador.
You might have made me what I am, but I can be so much more than what you created me to be.
I've come home to rejoin the family.
But master called me home! I have to get to him!
The ballroom door's locked and I need the key.
I'm looking for Cazador. Where is he?
How about I start breaking bones and keep going until I find that key?
I do want to hurt you, if that's what you mean.
Isn't it obvious? I'm here to kill Cazador.
I know you're there, Godey. Stop skulking and show yourself.
Doors can be unsealed. Just give us the key and we'll show ourselves in.
He needs me to complete the ritual. He'll be furious if you stop me from joining him.
I have no idea what these wretches are doing here. 'The Master' had a more refined palate than this.
But I am grateful for one thing. You showed me how to really savour moments like this.
It means you have a choice.
I... I think we're done here.
Let's hope for gold.
Let's go.
Don't mind me. I'm just enjoying the show.
You're right.
I am done picking up after Cazador. I wash my hands of all of this. This place, this ritual, these people.
You can stay if you want, but I have a life and I intend to live it.
Come on. Let's go.
Your choices are simple, really.
It will become everyone's business if you try to feast on half the city. This is just a friendly warning.
And I want to live a full life! Not some half existence, hiding in the shadows for the rest of eternity.
I'm not him, and I will not become him.
Please! I can't do this alone.
Unmaking what you made me.
Help me do this. Please.
I can feel it! I CAN FEEL THEIR POWER FLOWING INTO ME!
Now we deal with the elder brain. I no longer require its parasite, so we can end this once and for all.
What's in here?
I don't like it, but you're right. Putting them to rest may be the kindest thing we can do.
Follow the tunnels to the Underdark. You'll be... well, not 'safe' there, but in less peril.
A quick rummage.
You can hide here, living in the shadows like parasites, or you can be more than what he made us to be.
The poor wretches in the cells are innocent. They shouldn't have to suffer just because I lured them here.
They'll need someone to lead them. Take the tunnels into the Underdark, find somewhere... well, not safe, but less perilous?
Just try to keep them out of trouble.
It's over. It's finally over.
No, no. No healing sleep for you. Wake up!
What are you waiting for? Help me!
I can do this, but I need your help.
Yes. He's gone.
These people died years ago, trust me on that. All that's left are feral spawn, desperate for blood.
But if they die and I ascend, I won't have to rely on the parasite to walk in the sun. I'll be free - truly, completely free. Isn't that what you want?
You - you're right. I can be better than him.
But I'm not above enjoying this.
'You can do whatever you want' sounds terrifying - and it is - but there's opportunity in it, too.
You can choose differently, of course, but the consequences are on your head.
Now that's a better question. Seven thousand spawn, from ancient conquests to stolen children...
We're not like those wretches, brother. We've spent lifetimes controlling our hunger - they're all but feral.
I don't relish it any more than you do, but putting them to rest may be the kindest thing we can do.
If we release them, how many people will they kill? Tens of thousands? Hundreds of thousands?
Hardly. Cazador didn't keep me in luxury, but I've never seen anything like this.
I know so many of these faces.
You don't understand - it's not just him.
Funny, but unbecoming.
I hope you're not here to beg. It's so unbecoming.
Still, I would've liked more for my trouble than a pat on the head and vinegar for wine.
True. That was fun.
Enjoy myself? There's a worm in my brain, I'm surrounded by idiots, and all I've got to drink is wine that tastes like vinegar.
That means I have to survive tonight. And this party.
Enjoy myself? There's a worm in my brain, hunters on my trail, and all I've got to drink is wine that tastes like vinegar.
All I want is a little fun. Is that so much to ask?
See what I mean? Awful.
That's a 'no' to fun, then?
Cheeky. I'll see you then.
Will you now? Don't take too long. You're not the only tasty morsel here.
Fine. Enjoy your night with whatever beast will have you.
I remember you.
How are you still alive?
That scar on your face - it must bind you to Cazador's Black Mass.
That scar on your face - what does it mean?
You're eager, aren't you? But we need to wait a little longer.
Once everyone's in their bedrolls, we'll slip out of ours and find each other.
Do you mind? I'm very busy.
Are you now? Well, lucky him.
I don't know. I'm sure a vampire spawn could still rip your throat out if he felt like it.
We've all survived so far. Let's focus on that.
Indeed it is. We should do something about this threat.
These days, I'm making the impossible look easy.
May I?
Wait - that's it? We're just walking away?
Don't you think we should do something about the... vampire issue?
Fine. But if this comes back to bite us, it's on your head.
Sebastian.
They'd better bloody not.
You idiot. What have you done?
You treacherous little worm!
Something terrifying, no doubt. Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?
What in the Hells are you planning to do?
This is nicely barbaric and vulgar.
If you're looking for another shot, I'm afraid you've missed it.
Having fun yet?
Thank you so much for telling me. Now please do piss off.
Excellent.
The scar on your face - it must bind you to Cazador's Black Mass. I need to kill him.
I'm here to stop the Black Mass - to kill Cazador.
You should be dead. Why didn't Cazador feed on you?
They could be sacrifices for the Black Mass, but where did he get them all?
But who knows? Maybe the old man's tastes've changed since I left.
You - no. You're dead.
You were handsome. Shy. You'd never been kissed.
It can't be -
So Cazador marked them too - bound us all to his ritual.
Gods, I know so many of these faces.
Then they're bound to the Black Mass too. Bound through the scars. And through me.
How did they get here? What is Cazador doing with them? My brethren spoke nothing of this...
I know these faces - every one that shares my scar.
They're my conquests. I pursued them, seduced them, then brought them to Cazador. He told us he was feeding on them.
But he turned them to spawn. He turned every last one so he'd have souls for this cursed ritual.
One hundred and seventy years. You were one of my first.
That's why we're here - to destroy Cazador.
I promise you, I know that feeling all too well. But it can be done.
Trust me when I say I know the feeling. But you can resist the urge.
We'll be back. You have my word.
Don't. Not now.
It's not just him - I know so many of these faces.
I think the answer to that is 'whatever they damn well please'.
How did they get here? What is Cazador doing with them? I should have guessed there was more to it than Raphael would ever have told.
I can put this right, I swear. I can kill Cazador and free us all.
I'm so sorry.
One hundred and seventy years. You were one of my first too.
I can fix this. When I kill Cazador, you'll be free.
I've done the impossible before.
Tell me where he is, and I swear I'll end him.
When he's dead, you'll be mine to command.
I truly wanted you - Cazador forced me to harm you. I'll kill him.
Well, at least you only had the best.
Oh they're disgusting. Cazador never fed on wretches like this.
There were so many of you - I can't remember them all.
Read his thoughts.
Try to remember his name.
You're mistaken. I have no idea who you are.
Who are these wretches?
I... I recognise that voice. You were in the Blushing Mermaid.
That scar - Cazador did that to you? He bound you to the Black Mass?
That scar - Cazador did that to you? What does it mean?
I can put this right, I swear. I'm here to stop the Black Mass - to kill Cazador.
I don't remember. I'm sorry.
Oh don't worry, darling. I won't bite unless you ask very, very nicely.
What are you doing? No - stop!
It's - it's gone. All that power.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Wyll seem to be getting on very well.
I wonder if he uses magic in the bedroom? That could go very well or very badly.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Gale seem to be getting on very well.
Not what I'd call 'passionate', or 'interesting', but sweet.
It's easy for some. You and Shadowheart seem to have a connection. It looks very sweet.
Ha! No, I've seen enough blades in my time.
Ha! No. If he had an incubus instead of that cambion? That might be a different story.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the tiefling.
Ha! No, my love, I'm not jealous of the walking encyclopaedia.
Ha! No, my love, you and Shadowheart can get up to whatever you want. It means nothing to me.
Serious or not, it's something.
I'm sure it'll be adequate.
It's easy for some. I see Lae'zel's marked you as her territory.
I'm just looking for a little more excitement. A little more fun.
Forgiveness? You've never forgiven anything.
Every mistake, every slip was punished!
No! No, fuck you and fuck everything you've ever done to me.
Are you looking forward to seeing his 'Blade of Frontiers'? I hope it's more greatsword than dagger.
It's easy for some, of course. You and Karlach seem to be getting on very well.
It's none of my business, of course. I wouldn't want to intrude.
Bravo! I didn't think you had it in you.
Do you think Wyll would approve? I saw how he looked at you earlier.
Do you think Karlach would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Do you think Gale would approve? I saw how he looked at you earlier.
Do you think Shadowheart would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Do you think Lae'zel would approve? I saw how she looked at you earlier.
Not at all! I was hoping for companionship and - well, maybe a little death. Figuratively speaking.
Nothing so dramatic. Just you and me and - well, maybe a little death? Figuratively speaking.
Anyway, don't let me keep you. I'm sure you have someone else to sniff around.
You son of a bitch!
I mean, can you imagine? Urgh. No.
Watch, maybe, but never intrude.
Not least of whom is our friend, the new Grand Duke.
Let's be quick.
Crack it open.
Make it quick.
We will need to be careful, of course. There are still powerful forces in the city.
Oh, darling. I love the way you think.
Just be grateful that my ears can't bleed.
Not with you, just to be clear.
Urgh... argh...
That's what you think, you son of a bitch!
No! Stop him! And get me out of this!
I'll be here, waiting for the sunrise.
By all means, go and enjoy yourself.
But what do I get for all my hard work? A pat on the head and vinegar for wine.
We killed some goblins to save some tieflings. The tally of lives didn't change much.
I hate it. This is awful.
Never thought I'd be the one they toast for saving so many lives. And now that I'm here...
You know, I never pictured myself as a hero.
So I can see from all your heavily-armed friends. You didn't think I could resist completing the ritual, did you?
I am here to take my rightful place. I'm going to ascend.
Thank you. And for what it's worth - I'm sorry. I wish I could return the ones I took from you.
Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there.
While they're distracted.
My darling, of course! I want nothing more.
Just full of surprises, aren't you?
Cazador may be gone, but there are still thousands of vampire spawn down there. Including your children.
Really? I'm hurt.
Out of my way. I'm in no mood to talk.
They were innocents. To kill them would have been an even greater crime.
Oh please, there's no need for such language. I promised you Cazador's death and I more than delivered.
No, I wouldn't want to get in the middle of whatever that is. We'll end tonight as friends.
Soon you'll be begging for your life.
I'm an angel of vengeance. That's what you made me.
I don't need anyone to speak for me.
But until the moment's right, we can still be together. We can still taste all the delights of this world.
Picking under pressure.
Not the best timing.
No! Shut up!
I don't owe you a damn thing.
I'm here to stop you and this cursed ritual.
What is this? Why are the others in chains?
We're finishing this ritual. But I'm taking the power, not you.
I've soared without you. I've walked in the sunlight.
No. I'm not some goat to sacrifice in your ritual.
What is this? What are you doing to them?
It's time for you to die.
Resist his blood magic. Without allies, it's all over if he takes control of you.
Force your body to resist - don't let him control you.
Give in, let him control you.
And if I do join them?
You can't kill all these people. I won't let you.
I've been free of your rules. I've tasted the blood of thinking creatures.
Oh? And bring him where, exactly?
Well, that'd certainly spice up this evening.
All right, but don't take too long. You're not the only tasty morsel around here.
True, he has a lot of power at his fingertips. He could be a threat.
True, she could be a threat.
My love. You always know the right thing to say.
I wonder...
Perhaps we'll even meet again someday. The future is yet to be written, after all.
As for you... I wish you well. I'm sure you'll land on your feet.
Stab him.
You saved me to create a pawn you could use! I should kill you for that alone.
Don't mind if I do.
I'll just help myself.
I don't need you - I don't need anyone. I already have everything I want.
You stupid, ungrateful, little- Fine. Fine! To hells with you, I'll take Baldur's Gate myself.
Seems it won't take 'no' for an answer.
Well well, it likes you. Whatever the hells it is.
Excuse me? You want to leave - now? At my moment of triumph? Have you lost your mind?!
How lucky you are that I chose you as my consort. Chose you to help me take Baldur's Gate, then sit by my side as I rule it.
Yes, please.
True, if he ever branches out from fighting the Infernal, he'd be a formidable threat.
The Absolute may be gone, but others will rise against us. Maybe even our old allies.
We may need a purge or two. Just to secure our position.
Tell me how to complete the ritual and I might spare you.
Don't you tell me what I needed!
All you had to do was stand there! But no, even that was too much much to ask.
I was so close. I could have had it all, but you took everything from me.
Cazador won after all. I'll never escape the hell he built.
And if I can't escape, then no one can. Not them...
And certainly not you.
Don't you dare! I CAN FEEL THEIR POWER FLOWING INTO ME!
But if I complete the ritual, think of the power I'll have. With me by your side, we can save the city - we can save ourselves!
Stop bleeding - it's distracting.
Trust me, I know what I'm doing.
Maybe they will. Maybe they won't. Maybe it doesn't matter.
He's not wrong. There's always going to be a part of him in me.
Pull him from the coffin.
Tell me how to complete the ritual.
Stab him without a word.
I'm waiting to hear you beg for your life.
Oblivion can be arranged.
All right. You can live.
Get over here. We can do this.
We'll fix what we can.
Stab him without another word.
Then tell me how to complete the ritual.
Then do! Slake your thirst.
Use the staff to destroy the prisoners.
Use the staff to set the prisoners free.
Destroy the staff so they can never escape.
They're not my concern.
I simply do not care.
That depends. Can you swear to me you won't feed on mortals?
You don't have to eat rats. Feast on a lion or a dragon - just not people.
Do what you like, it's none of my concern.
Start killing people and I'll stop you. Just like I stopped Cazador.
Try to remember the runes on your back and carve them into Cazador's flesh.
Just kill him.
Give him his wish - kill him.
Walk away.
And here I mistook you for someone with taste. A pity.
You know, we could always make our own entertainment, darling. Get a little closer, so to speak.
Don't be so sour. I like a good time as much as anyone.
Never listen to your second thoughts. They always spoil the fun.
Do what you like, but you're dealing with the consequences.
Let's wait until things quieten down. Once the others are asleep, we'll find each other.
You can try, but I will stop you. Just like I stopped Cazador.
What do you want it to mean?
Then you can bear my runes and be sacrificed in my place.
Try not to die.
You're leaking.
You owe me.
The tadpole is gone, which means your future is mine to decide.
Hahaha! Don't be stupid, darling. You're mine, remember?
Just when I thought I couldn't love you any more.
Looks like your toy has other ideas. I think you're stuck with it.
Don't. People ask questions when bodies start appearing.
Perhaps it needs a magic word? Try 'please'. Or 'sledgehammer'.
Enter your companion's mind and see the scars through their eyes.
Carve the symbols into his back.
Begin the ritual.
This feels incredible. I'm a new person.
Bow before the greatest vampire the Sword Coast has ever seen!
It doesn't feel much different, honestly.
Kill Cazador and abandon the ritual.
It means you're free - you can do whatever you want.
What a pretty thing. I imagine it's dangerous - most pretty things are.
Yes, yes, fine. It's just - specific. Why not kill the gnolls or goblins rampaging around here?
Let's go, we've wasted enough time talking.
That bad.
Ah, travelling far and wide, seeing all this world has to offer. A fine life indeed.
I admit, since my ascension it's been a charmed existence. Everything I ever wanted is right at my fingertips.
We've already had one heart-to-heart - best to leave it at that, don't you think? I'm not sure I can manage another bout of sentimentality.
You're not done already, surely?
You can't want to go already. Enjoy tonight, celebrate with our sweet friends.
And when you're done, we can get back to enjoying forever together.
We have eternity for chit-chat, my love - the others only get you for tonight. I can't keep you all to myself.
Power and prestige? Hail the Grand Duke indeed.
Grand Duke Ravengard!
People are fickle beasts. What makes you think they'll welcome you as their protector?
You think the city will welcome you as grand duke? Horns and all?
You're joking. Please tell me you're joking.
It's time to exterminate them. To cleanse my city of their filth.
Now that I can enjoy the sun without needing their parasite, the mind flayers serve no further purpose.
My dark forces are at your command today. We have a common goal.
What do you think you're doing?
What are you doing?! Stop it!
A soul after my own heart! Assuming you have any soul left, of course.
But I am glad to see you're living life to the fullest. We deserve nothing less, you and I.
Gods, really? Well, if that's what tickles you, I suppose.
Into the shadows.
Alas, not every deal with a devil works out as well as it did for me.
Oh, that is excellent! I had hoped you would cause a little chaos down there. And some carnage to boot by the sounds of it.
Well, it sounds very enjoyable to me, so I trust you're having a darling time.
Well, I shall be sure to let you know if I spot any.
Thankfully we're just two good friends, reminiscing and enjoying life.
The Blade of Frontiers, famed for protecting the weak and slaying monsters. I hope you don't think either will be necessary tonight.
Please, when have I ever behaved?
Ha! Oh no, my boy. I haven't felt weak in a long, long time.
She must be at camp. I think she was getting a little too hot under the collar.
The feeling is very mutual. Even if I was laughing behind your back.
My murderous little friend! What have you been up to? Fallen back into old habits?
Well, that's a relief. I didn't want to ruin a perfectly good evening by having to kill you.
Never mind a perfectly good set of clothes. This cloth stains at the slightest drop of blood. It's awful.
Ah, a sensible pastime indeed. You must tell me all about it sometime. I'm sure I'd find it fascinating.
Ah, a mutual interest! You must tell me all about it sometime - if only to make sure our plans don't clash.
My first and oldest friend. The last six months have been kind to you.
A blessing, no less? Well isn't that just darling?
A pity that you let the real blessing slip through your fingers, of course. Though we all make mistakes.
But I am glad you came - and I genuinely mean that. An evening like this would not be the same without you.
Hold on - we're a body short. Where's Karlach?
My children! What a beautiful sight.
Strange... I miss him. More than I thought I would.
I suppose we'd better honour Gale - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar and a room full of virgins.
Leave no trace.
On the hunt.
I suppose we'd better honour Gale, - perhaps there's a library somewhere that has a bar...
Do they? Well, there must be something to it, then.
Now they see me...
By all means, go and live however you wish. As long as we don't get in each other's way, I'm sure all will be well.
At this point, you've earned it. Just don't start any grand designs, and I'm sure we'll all stay friends.
I suppose you're right. We've been through enough.
It's not so bad in the dark. Only about half of the Baldurian sewers are active.
The Underdark? Now that's a thought. Just not to the Drow - they don't treat pretty boys too kindly. Or any boys at all, really.
The Underdark is a popular option. Just try to avoid the vampire spawn - I can't promise they'll be as friendly as yours truly.
Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. It's been so long since I've had a fine wine. And we have more than earned it.
Yes! We should see if the Elfsong's still standing. I won't imbibe, but I'll be happy to be away from here, and in your company.
I honestly don't mind what we do, once we get - ow!
What the - oh no. Oh gods.
Well... it was nice while it lasted.
Argh! I'm sorry, I - I have to go!
You are braver than I could ever dream to be. I hope we will meet again, on a cloudy night.
The Blade of Avernus, fresh from the Hells. And how are you enjoying your infernal crusade?
You - what? Now? After all this?!
Now there's a sight to see. Not that I'll miss them... No offence.
Of course, it did cost us a wizard. But - well, it was his choice.
Of course, it did cost us a wizard. Poor Gale.
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, I'm not going to turn into a mind flayer!
The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, we're not going to turn into mind flayers!
The wizard did it... he really did it. He blew up the brain.
And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.
And I didn't even have to turn into a mind flayer to do it!
Speaking of githyanki, will you be joining them, Lae'zel?
And we didn't even have to turn into mind flayers to do it!
And I'm still standing in the sun. This is incredible! Maybe whatever it changed in me was permanent?
Ha! Victory! Our enemies are dust at our feet.
I - I can't feel the tadpole. It's gone - we're free!
No, stop you fool!
Lae'zel, don't - Stop!
Well that's a pleasant sight. Here's hoping they stay in their own plane.
Speaking of the Astral Plane - aren't you going to join them, Lae'zel?
Now there's a sight to see. Not that I'll miss them.
We're free of that stupid parasite. And I'm free to enjoy all the power Cazador left me.
Although I suppose there is a lot to do here - power to consolidate, a palace to claim. It will take time.
Well no, I have had a busy schedule. I've been mixing with Baldur's Gate highest society, after all. Making connections, gaining influence - finding my place in this beautiful city of yours.
People like us cannot just put on and cast aside the trappings of power. We're special, you and I.
Suit yourself. Sweet dreams.
The pleasure is all mine. Sweet dreams.
You rest. I'll keep watch.
You sleep. I'll keep watch.
I need some time to think things through. To process this.
I'll be awake awhile yet. Today has been a lot.
I'm in no place to rest yet. Today has been a lot.
Curling up in the dirt and resting is... a little novel.
The night normally means bustling streets, bursting taverns.
No, I'm more than happy to put my feet up. I'm just not used to this.
It's all a little new to me, I admit.
I suppose. I'm not sure what I expected, really. This is all a little new.
So, we're resting here? Turning in for the night?
Shadowheart seems jumpy. Must not relish the thought of sprouting tentacles.
Your gith friend seems on edge. Mustn't relish the thought of sprouting tentacles.
Do you mind? I'm brooding.
Your magician seems dour tonight. Must not relish the idea of sprouting tentacles.
You know, if you want to spend time with me you only have to say so.
But suit yourself. I'm sure we'll drift off at some point.
Ah, no - tea isn't really my drink.
I'll be awake awhile anyway. I need some time to think things through. To process this.
Indeed you did - I'll make sure the plebs of this city know who they should thank for their continued existence.
Baldur's Gate will never forget it. And neither will I.
Really? Good gods.
Good! You should always be comfortable in your own skin. Even if that skin is new and... glistening.
Behold my tears.
Apologies. I just got swept up in - well - surviving.
I would say no offence meant, but... well. Look at you.
Oh, eh - sorry. I didn't mean to... well, you know.
Understandable. Can't say I'm a fan either. It's just hard to join in when all of this feels so new.
You may be mortal, but you look... well, happy. And you wear it rather well.
Or... projected? Honestly, if I'd known this was an option, I would have stayed at home too.
Oh yes, the war! Forgive me, it slipped my mind entirely.
It's good to see you too. A pity we can't share a drink, it's been too long, darling.
I have been rather busy, you see. I'm now a man of power and influence - it doesn't leave much time for indulging in treats like this.
Well... Maybe a little. But I'm not complaining - anything that means I get to see my old friends again.
I wasn't sure you'd want to stay on our humble plane. You haven't gone native, have you?
Oh, been indulging your appetite, have you? So have I, as it happens.
You should visit some time. Now that I'm a man of influence, I'm sure we could satisfy any cravings you had.

Argh! You wretched little -

All right, we'll do this the old-fashioned way.

A pleasure.

Splendid.
Now, I saw you on the ship, didn't I? Nod.

Turn us into - ha. Hahaha!

Funny.

Good luck, I suppose. Here's hoping we're still wearing the same skins when we next meet.
I need to find out more before I let anyone root around in my skull. I'll find an expert.
These worms are doing something - I can feel it. What are you going to do about it?

All right, I accept. Lead on.

Good luck.

I was ready to go this alone, but maybe sticking with the herd isn't a bad idea. Safety in numbers, after all.

Gladly.

Good for you.

In striking distance.
Swiftly now.
Ah, the fruit of scholars. How I long to have a troop of loyal students grace me with apples by the orchard-full in exchange for wisdoms imparted...
Step by step.
I don't fancy their chances.
Allow me to demonstrate.
Mystra-Ryl!
Step to it.
I'll enjoy myself well enough from back here! You go on and do... the rutting or what have you.
No thank you. Sounds as appealing as milking cottage cheese directly from a geriatric cow.
My word.
Good move.
Perhaps you're overestimating my affection towards you a tad? You'd better seek a partner-in-embarrassment elsewhere.
What are you doing? That's no way to treat a book!
Well, if you insist...
I am involved! I'm taking notes. Making observations.
He won't be able to help us no - unless he happens to have a cure on his corpse.
Death is but a word away.
What fools these mortals be.
I've had a little stone caught in my boot the last while - clearly that makes for a better travelling companion than you do.
Victory is assured.
The lanceboard is set.
Let's light them up.
May the dice roll in my favour.
I have a bad feeling that dead elf is Halsin. He can't help us now.
Hold on! It's not too late to settle this without bloodshed.
It is. It's Tara! What's she doing all the way out here?
No gloom, all doom.
Without delay.
With haste.

Are you sure...? I could conjure up any sight that you could dream of, and a few you could not. I could use the Weave to make us feel sensations beyond reckoning. I could do more than woo you. I could wow you.
Allow me to live dangerously while I still can.
As you like. Thank you, for spending this time with me. If only there was more.
A small gesture towards your comfort.
The old ways then. If that is what you wish, so be it.
...but we shall try.

When you wake, it will be back at our camp, back in our small, dirty, bloody patch of existence. But stay with me now. There are endless worlds out there. Countless ways to declare love. Infinite ways to express it. Too much for one night...
Why confine ourselves to the pleasures of mortal flesh? It is but one stitch in a vast tapestry. Let me show you more.
The stars will be our bed. Come here.
Then let's set the book aside an be blank slates on blank sheets, delightfully new.
This one here is called 'The Art of the Night'. It details the first thousand nights of a newlywed king and queen.
On the contrary. No one is lonely when they have books - except perhaps the illiterate.
It's called 'The Art of the Night', and it details the first thousand nights of a newlywed king and queen.
My favourite spot. Many times, evening turned to night and back to daybreak once more while I sat here, lost in words.
The grand piano plays the Lliirian Suites all by itself, and as we look out beyond the arches that lead to the terrace, we see the weary sun take its daily dive into the sea.
The sculptures, the paintings, the walls enlivened by the spines of a thousand books.
The scene is this: you and I stand in the room that is the centre of my universe.
How about the perfect night in Waterdeep? Yes... Let's imagine how it would be.
I want it to be perfect - to bond with you in the way that gods do... intertwining our spirits in visions of the Weave.
Not if I have any say in the matter.
Nice to return to familiar environs.
Let's get you on your feet.
And that's my mother's sitting room?
Yes, you are. Trust me, I would know. Let's do it your way then. So long as it's with you.
I'd give a lot to be able to kiss you right now. But your presence itself is more than enough. A night stargazing with you is the greatest gift I could ask for.
Such power leads to only one outcome. Corruption...
A familiar feeling rises within you. Temptation...
Doddering old fool. Trust him to leave the hard work to you.
He would never inflict such cruel terms on you. Mystra must have forced his hand.
You failed her once. You will not fail her again.
The Absolute must be stopped. If this is the only way, so be it.
To wield enough power to threaten a god. That would be quite something...
You think on the Netherese magic affecting your tadpole. A magic Mystra abhors...
You wonder, did he even try to intervene on your behalf?
His disappointment cuts deeper even than Mystra's. He was your hero...
Fewer than if the Absolute goes unchecked. I don't want to kill, and I don't want to die... but inaction will lead to bloodshed all the same.
I can feel it - ever since we set foot in this strange, corrupted land. The closer we get, the heavier my own heart becomes.
But it will not matter, soon enough. Let us just enjoy the view, in silence. We will leave the world a better place than it is tonight.
Heartening words - if only they came from the lips of another. This is no time for delusion - we are not close, you and I.

Those bonds will soon break. But you were a worthy ally, and could have become much more, in other circumstances. Let us just enjoy the view together. We will leave the world a better place than it is tonight.
Your words are those of a dear friend, or a lover even. But this is no time for delusions - fate threw us together, and mutual survival kept us together.
A good night indeed. The fairest I can imagine...
Stay with me, will you? I don't want to think of it any more, but I don't want to be alone either.
If there is a way - any way - to save all that's grown dear to me, I want to seize it. I just can't fathom what that might be, other than to fail Mystra and condemn the world.
Damn you. Damn you for giving me so much to care about. Our friends, our adventures... this would have been so much easier if it was just me. But it isn't.
Yes... but there is so much to live for, and so few moments in which to house it all.
Thank you, for spending this time with me. I think I want to be alone now.
I see... well perhaps this is for the best. Should my time be short, you will not be wounded too deeply by my absence.
That's a relief. It would be a shame to spend my final hours making an ass of myself.
To the rescue.
A fair assessment - I wish we had more time to practice together.
Achoo! Pardon me.
There's an almost reverent silence that accompanies the peak of darkness, when you'd almost believe the dawn will never break.
I love this time of night.
I'm placing my bets on a resounding 'no'. An innocent tiefling died by our hands.
Long before my time, thank goodness. That's not an image I care to dwell on.
Hopefully not during the party.
Something of the sheen of Elysium missing, isn't there?
Tara, you must practice acceptance. My new powers are to be utilised, not feared.
Oh, Tara. It hurts to be so misunderstood by my oldest friend.
Still, I mustn't frighten them with my newfound powers...
Haven't you any ambitions, Tara? I could help you, you know.
A prayer or two would suffice. Is that so bad?
Tara, did you just hiss at me?!
To be a god among men...
Ah, the material plane. I'd almost forgotten what it's like.
So very stubborn.
You sound a man with the nine hells at his heels.
You'd think a magical apparition with an urgent message would be deserving of some attention...
I hope my spell doesn't wear off before the toasts begin.
A word, please? It's very, very important.
Aha! There you are, my mortal friend.
Aha! There you are!
So, you didn't fancy sharpening up the old moniker? I'd have thought the 'Blade of Frontiers' might be feeling a bit dull after all you've been through.
Orbs of dragonkind. Could it be? I thought only three were left.
The cradle of eternity.
The timelessness of lovers.
That most beautiful of fantasies.
Indeed. The curse is still present of course - just veiled and at arm's length for now. Not a trick I can repeat often, but tonight? Tonight is different.
And you're a bad liar. I lived the life of a hermit for some time before I met you - safer for all, but not conducive to pleasures of the flesh.
Tara! I never knew you to be cruel.
Nice little spot, isn't it?
I'm in love with you.
If things were different, if we were home, I'd have taken the time to do things properly. To say it all better. But time is short.
I didn't realise you were such a homebody, Tara.
I know this is all unreal, but I created it for you. You must know that you're... That you're very special to me.
Suddenly I had a spot of d√©j√† vu.
One moment with you could sate me for a lifetime, and prise the fear from my heart. I'm so very glad you came, to share this with me.
Stay with me a while, will you? Day will come all too soon, even in this place.
My knees are a little stiff. Must be a storm coming.
Nothing, unless you can find a way to defeat the elder brain...
I can only hope that there are few innocents within the Absolute's reach, when the time comes... and that you will seek safety, far away from me.
My knees are aching terribly.
There is no point in running from the inevitable. Better to meet it, on my own terms.
I am terrified - I will not claim otherwise. My face could scarcely conceal it even if my words sought to deny it.
I am trying. Believe me, I am. The path is set, and I will not stray from it - even as my heart quakes.
Babe or crone, coward or hero, death is assured. Mystra's forgiveness is not. If you knew the end was near, would you not want to ensure it had meaning?
I thought this place might bring me peace. I thought it might make the weight of what I must do feel a little lighter... but I am not so sure.
...and with company to match.
This may be my last night alive. I wanted it to be under a canopy of beauty and wonder...
So it is. But a very fine one.
I wanted to see you. While I still could.
I will be, soon. I am perhaps just one hard day away from being without any troubles at all.
Resigned to it, rather. But that is not to say I am without fear. Far from it.
Good. Let's focus on the girl first. We can settle with the snake later.
He defies Mystra himself in saying so. He wouldn't do that without good reason.
She gives what she can. And you receive her aid gratefully.
Mystra soothes all pain.
I have your back.
No other choice, I suppose.
Yes, yes.
Don't fret, I'm on my way.
How bothersome.
How tedious.
A waste of my talents.
In trouble? Small wonder.
Not this again.
There's always one.
I'm indispensible, aren't I?
One touch of magic coming up.
I have power enough to share - if I must.
One by one.
Checkmate.
The lesson is death.
Don't worry too much. A handful of powerful spells go a long way.
While the iron is hot.
Into the fray.
On my honour.
Danse macabre.
Well I suppose it would do no good to back out now. Let us begin this little anthropological study, if we must.
A little help from a friend.
I'd prefer you didn't do this. If I'm not enough for you, I could always conjure us some kind of non-sentient companion.
You can count on me.
Let them do their worst.
Swords, meet sorcery!
A battle of wits.
Creator. Destroyer.
Merely planning ahead. Besides, never hurts to befriend a wizard.
In that case, I'd very much appreciate it if you could arrange an introduction should we reach the city.
Word in Waterdeep has it he's a bit of a cad. But you say he's an accomplished wizard?
I've heard that name before. A young man, yes? Lives in Ramazith's Tower in the Upper City?
This grove is like a cauldron about to boil over. I say we check in on the child - make sure she comes to no harm.
Yes, of course.
Let us confer.
A little discourse.
With silver tongue.
My pleasure.
I can do that.
Up for debate.
A word.
Keep up! There's still a battle to be won.
Let them do their worst.
Surely you should be reserving your foot for more deserving foes? That poor creature was harmless!
My bedside manner is beyond reproach.
Never fear.
The light of life.
Keep up! There's still a battle to be won.
Allow me.
This is all a bit much for me. Back home in Waterdeep, I prefer to have Tara leave the room before I undress.
I appreciate that - but I can't help how I feel. Sorry.
I might enjoy watching you tangled up with the drow, as long as I was five paces back.
Where are my smelling salts?
Oh dear.
Willing and able.
No time to lose.
At once.
Curiouser and curiouser...
She might be right. You've drawn powers from a grim source.
You will reward her faith in you. When the time comes, you will be ready.
You will destroy the Absolute. Not for her, but for everyone else.
You'll learn more about the Heart. Only then will you decide.
She's going to be disappointed. You've no intention of dying.
You've been indulging yourself. No harm in that.
Dangerous or not, you need all the help you can get.
She has no right to interfere. You don't answer to her.
It could be sabotage, an attempt to deny you your chance at redemption...
Impossible. Elminster's utterly devoted to her.
Useless trifles. She still keeps the Weave's true power for herself.
She forced her favours upon you. You owe her nothing.
Her gifts have their uses, but she still leaves the hard work to you.
You are.
Not for her, but for everyone else.
You'll die on nobody's orders. Especially not hers.
No. If Elminster believes there's another way, so do you.
Quickly now.
Help's on the way.
On it.
Won't know what hit 'em.
You're adorable even when you're teasing me. But I must decline.
I'd rather tangle with a dragon than get tangled in all those limbs.

A stirring verse, to rouse heroes depleted.   
But not for us, because we went and cheated.
Filial betrayal, is it? A tale as old as the gods themselves.
Perhaps she needs a moment.
I'm interested in the procedure, actually. Please, go ahead.
What are you doing? Stand back! Now!
Let's take a breath - the odds are stacked against us if we try to pick a fight now.
Let's let cooler heads prevail, eh? I'm not sure I like our odds if we pick a fight here.
Don't - we'd face very poor odds if you start a fight now.
Hmm. I can think of more trustworthy accomplices - more than a few, in fact.
Elminster's an enigma. Who knows what games he's playing.
Ravengard hasn't given up yet. His true self is still in there, and could yet be saved.
Is that... Tara? Why, I think it is!
I think that's another tressym...
I'm rather a dab hand myself when it comes to a spot of intellectual intrigue...
That was reckless. In a devil's hands, the crown could be as dangerous as any artefact in existence - we need to nullify the terms of that deal.
A spell a day...
Nemesis.
With glee.
I strike with precision.
Their worst nightmare.
Mine is the advantage.
On the double.
A tad harsh, don't you think? Our fire will be no cooler just for sharing it with a child in need.
Rook to queen six.
If nothing else, I hope it was a mercifully short one.
Pawn to cleric four.
Say yes. But if words fail you, I'll accept a kiss.
No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. What do you say...?
It won't, I swear to you. It's merely a tool - a means to an end.
You told me once to choose you, the one who loved me. That's what this is all about. Do you doubt me?
You mean... you want the same as I do?
I've never wanted to kiss you more than I do now.
Then it will be so. With you and I together, there's not a force in existence that can stop us.
But think what I offer. The vastness of eternity to explore, the Weave at our fingertips... You would really prefer me as I am?
What more is there to be said?
I hope you're right. I truly do. Godly power, perhaps I can live without, but you? You're everything.
You put the stars to shame. Let's sit here another while - I want to drink you in.
You see me as I am, and do not find me wanting. With these stars as my witness, I swear - you will always be enough for me.
As you wish. Take a moment to soak the view. I doubt you will be privy to it again.
A little boat voyage, that's all. Indulge me.
I suppose if you see it that way... there's little else to be said, is there. Enjoy your evening.
Remain steadfast - there is nothing to fear from what awaits me. In fact... allow me to show you. Words alone are not enough.
But I could be so much more to you.
Please, close your eyes a moment.
No doubt it will be - abominably so. As is just about everything we do. But I know we're up to the task. Are you still with me?
Right now, I need nothing more than a kiss. Then we'll face what is to come, together. And claim the crown when the time comes.
I'm sorry. It's not easy living for more than just yourself, when for so long just staying alive was accomplishment enough.
You stole the words from my mouth.
I don't think I deserve you at times. I told you of my ambitions - the likes of which many would baulk at - and yet you remain at my side.
Words alone are not enough. Permit me to show you. Please, close your eyes a moment.
The Outer Planes. This is where gods dwell. Where they observe us from afar. Where they make play-things of us.
They would keep all of this from us - the power, the possibilities. They only want us to serve them, pray to them... and ultimately, die for them.

But what if we didn't need them? What if we wielded their power instead, and helped ourselves in all the ways they refuse to. I could make that happen. I could make this illusion a reality, with you by my side.
I'll always have you, Karlach.
How could I not crave this? But I don't want it for myself, alone - I want you at my side, willing and wholehearted.
Then have me - but have the best possible version of me.
I've already defied Mystra. Had I followed her command, there'd be nothing left of me but a smoking crater.
The tadpoles, the orb - these threats to our existence - the gods could aid us if they wished, but instead they cower behind Ao. So let us act ourselves.
With the power of the crown, any foe would be rendered impotent. Any obstacle would be dwarfed by our might.
I used to believe Mystra's forgiveness was worth dying for. But I was wrong. You showed me just how much I have to live for.
With you, I forget my goddess. I love you.
Tell me you feel the same way. Tell me you want what I want. Please.
Yes, you have. But I want more than your support. I want your heart.
There you are. I was worried you might have second thoughts after my little confrontation with Mystra.
Most would think me foolish, deluded even, for daring to pursue dreams of wielding Karsus' Crown. I do not take your faith lightly.
Ah, you've a moment for me? I was hoping to speak to you - I confess, my thoughts have been somewhat scattered since my audience with Mystra.
Some mistakes can't be resolved with an apology. Some mistakes, you have to carry with you, forever.
You're smarter than that. It's part of what drew me to you.
I'm smarter than that, and so are you. It's part of what drew me to you.
I thought we shared something special, I truly did. Clearly I'm nothing but a smitten fool...
A fascinating question, one that boils down to which criteria we choose to apply. Are we speaking about the physiological? Theological? Etymological?
Oh. Then for your purposes, they are exactly the same.
Is that why you keep your head shaved? I assumed it was a custom of some sort.
No, of course she didn't. Why would I want anyone but you...?
Thank you, but I'm more wizard than warrior. I'm not sure my scalp would stand up to such a plaiting.
Yes, that would probably do it.
Wonderful! The more, the merrier.
Oh, come on, let her stay - we have room to spare.
We have room at the campfire yet - let the girl stay. I wouldn't want it said that I am any less than a perfect gentleman.
Go to sleep. If another knife awaits in the night, so be it.
An astral projection. Seems she's taking no chances with us.
Betrayed by a drow commander of the Absolute. How unexpected a turn of events.
So their reputation suggests - especially among the good folk of Waterdeep. I'm curious to learn how you fell foul of them...
I've... misjudged the situation. I gave my heart over to you too freely, and now it has been wounded. A mistake I shall not repeat.
As you say. Perhaps others could turn the other cheek, but I'm not that sort. It's for the best - to spare further heartache.
You still have me as an ally... but anything beyond that was just a fleeting dream - one from which I have now awoken.
The Karsite Weave could offer more than just power - it could bestow divinity. If I only trust myself to wield it.
I know this may not be the course you would choose for me, but before you protest - you should at least know what it is you would be advising against.
A pity I did not learn all she had to offer, but the fact that she summoned me to her presence is proof enough that the Crown of Karsus is worth pursuing.
I must admit, the Crown of Karsus has occupied my every thought since we learned of it.
If we can seize it, and use it... the possibilities are endless. Yet you haven't uttered a peep one way or the other about it.
The power to change the world - it may be within our reach. You must have an opinion, surely.
But I cannot. You would  not be able to either, if you knew what I knew. Please, allow me to show you. Just close your eyes a moment.
Then the fault lies with me, and my inadequate words. Please, allow me to show you instead. Just close your eyes a moment.
Thanks for letting me stay.
Any particular reason you did?
Ah I see. Practical as ever.
Well it's nice to be liked enough for people to choose horrible, necrotic death by your side, I guess.
I am really in a poor state. So tired. Might explode any day. Any night.

That was a very... passionate plea you held on my behalf.
Why so?
I had hoped my eyes were deceiving me... but no. You were with her, weren't you?
Diminish my feelings if you wish, but do not expect me to take this lying down - that's more your style, from what I can tell. My trust in you is broken.
If only your mind had been so set last night. But alas, that bell cannot be unrung.
If that's true, it's thanks to you, and the trust you show in me at every turn of this strange adventure of ours.
How does it feel to kill a woman still flush with the warmth of your body? All par for the course for you, I suppose.
Enjoy the rest of your evening.

It was easier to stare at the celestial abyss than recognise the emptiness within myself. Easier to pretend my destiny lay among such stars, than work to salvage a life on solid ground. You changed all that.
Mystra. I never thought we'd speak again like this. Why am I here?
Not yet.
I didn't call on you to make small talk. You owe me an explanation.
I didn't come for small talk. Why did you summon me?
And you look radiant.
What can I say? Adventuring suits me.
I owe you no explanation. Not after how you've treated me.
No thanks to you. I wasn't expecting a summons, but then you did always prefer things on your terms.
No wizard worth their hat would destroy such a powerful artefact without first understanding it.
I understand now why you asked what you did. I should use the orb, and ensure Karsus' powers are truly destroyed.
Very well. The next time we meet, I'll be bringing you the Crown.
You're the mother of all magic, the Weave incarnate. Can't you just destroy the Crown yourself?
Is that why you lied to me about the Crown of Karsus? Self-preservation?
You're one to talk. How many innocents were you prepared to sacrifice if I detonated the orb?
Then why did you strip me of my abilities? I could have put things right.
I never intended to do harm. Only to prove myself worthy of you.
I don't know. I need time to think.
So that's what you're scared of. The magic within me is one you can't control. But with the Crown of Karsus, I could.
I didn't want to die. And when I saw the Crown, I thought I might not have to, if I only understood its power.
I won't let you down again. When the Absolute is vanquished, I will surrender Karsus' powers to you. You have my word.
You're right. I am a strong, capable wizard. And this is no more than a casual reunion with an ex-lover.
Am I?
Time was I'd have given my right arm for a chance to speak with Mystra again. The left one too. Maybe a knee...
It's a summoning channel, the kind Mystra once used to call me to her side. I only have to reach for it, and it will take me to her side.
Strange... Do you feel that? It's as though the Weave itself is rushing past us...
A stream of pure, undiluted Weave. I only have to reach out, and it will carry me to Mystra, wherever she may be.
The old man wasn't lying. She's opened a summoning channel. Can't you feel it?
Well somebody had to. You weren't exactly forthcoming with any offers of help.
A word, if you please.
Clearly the matter has hardly been a priority of yours, but even so, you can consider it closed.
I no longer require assistance - neither yours, nor that of artefacts.
Because you had no right to ask that of me. You cast me out, remember?
You abandoned me in my hour of greatest need. I had no obligation to help you in yours.
So that's what you're scared of. With the Crown of Karsus reforged, I could take control of the Karsite Weave.
A great ask indeed. You've given me much to think on - as you always did.
Not happening. When I get my hands on that Crown, I'm going to wield it. Karsus' powers will be mine.
Remember how I told you I was in dire need of magical artefacts to absorb?
Our relationship bored you. The orb was just an excuse to end it.
You were threatened. You realised you couldn't control me.
I let you down. I was a fool, and fools don't deserve the love of a goddess.
Good night.
I owe you an apology. Things became quite heated between us before, after I learned of the Crown of Karsus. I allowed myself to get carried away, and failed to properly explain myself.
Thank you. But I owe you more than that. I need to help you understand just what this could mean for us.
When are we not doing something dangerous? Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.
I can't. Your opinion matters greatly to me. Give me a chance - I think I can help you understand.
Ah. You're still talking to me then?
I wouldn't blame you for giving me a wide berth. I thought the orb's ever-present censure had tamed my wilder ambition, but that wasn't the case.
Not really, no.
I needed Mystra's intervention. She offered me a path to redemption at last, and it might yet leave my mind and body intact.
That's all I ever need to hear.
I know what I must do. The Crown belongs under Mystra's stewardship, not mine, and I will ensure she gets it.
That means there'll be no permanent place in the heavens for us. But we could still visit.
Astra navigabimus.
Few mortals ever glimpse what you're about to see. But don't be alarmed - I'm here with you. Now... open your eyes.
Quite the view, isn't it? The Outer Planes are a place of profound, sometimes overwhelming possibility.
I conjured this illusion often during my confinement in Waterdeep. An escape for the mind, where there was none for the body.
Please - continue to believe in me. I want to show you the wizard I am capable of being, rather than the poor excuse for a man who's kept you company thus far.
Up to old tricks again, are we?
In my mind, you are quite blind.
No matter. All you see is what I want you to see.
Because I disobeyed you. You punished me for it.
I was a danger to you. What I did, or rather, attempted to do, was reckless.
I was afraid. Afraid to die. Afraid that I might fail.
Because my life isn't yours to throw away. You had no right to ask that of me.
Because I have someone else to live for.
Mystra. Please - I have so much to explain to you.
Reach out. Go to Mystra.
Not at all.
I've had a solution in mind for a while now, it just took me some time to... set it in motion.
That's it - I won't take more of your time this lovely evening. Rest well.
Stop that! How dare you...
Forget whatever it was you saw. It's all beyond you now anyway.
No more than what I had to - and that's all I'll say on the matter.
Much later. If ever.
Suit yourself. Like I said: I no longer require your assistance.
Stop that! How dare you - again...
Up to tricks, are we?
No matter. Far be it for me to impose the majesty of the celestial canvas on those unwilling to partake of its beauty.
My omnipotent, omniscient ex-lover...
But no matter. What's one more kill but a fitting coda to a day of carnage?
Massacre. A spectacle of slaughter. And I participated.
I'm sure she at least stuffs her fingers in her ears to muffle my invocations.
A common enough interpretation. Sickness has a nasty habit of making you feel trapped, if only within the confines of your own body.
When you've loved a goddess - as I have - people often think you less experienced in the ways of romance.
Ah. If that's the main criteria then I shall reset my expectations accordingly. Water it is.
A bar is only as good as its cellars. Which vintages can we expect to find on their racks?
What can I say? Mother always taught me to be a gracious host.
Thank you. Any particular reason?
I once spent weeks convalescing in the Hospice of St Laupsenn after a nasty bout of ruddy pox. For all their kindness, leaving that place behind felt like freedom to me.
Magic from the fallen empire of Netheril. Ancient, exceedingly dangerous, and quite unrivalled.
This is sobering news indeed, but there's no use crying over spilt milk. If this is our only option, to Moonrise Towers we go.
As did Mystra's home on Elysium. Her ribbed vaults and buttresses created a magic entirely of their own. Not to mention her pleasure domes...
I've said enough. Let silence do the talking.
