Nicely done. I probably couldn't have resisted kicking him in the teeth.
Good. We've had enough party games now, I think.
Understandable then, I suppose. Give him an extra kick for me, child.
That's a bigger fight than we needed to pick - not the subtlest of assassins, are you?
None of her friends around... Perfect time for a little discreet knifework.
Don't give me that look. I don't know what just happened any more than you do. We should keep going.
I think that was the Absolute speaking to us... but we managed to shield ourselves. We should keep moving.
I'm not sure I want to know - but it's gone now. We should keep moving.
Agreed.
Perhaps, but whatever it was, I don't want to experience it again.
Trust me, I will. Let's keep going.
I don't know... not exactly. All I know is it's important I get it back to Baldur's Gate. At any cost.
I suppose if we're to continue together, I may as well tell you. I serve Shar. My home is a secret cloister in Baldur's Gate.
Hmm, you feel a little more substantial than before. Less camping and scrounging off the land, I take it?
Only if you leave me feeling lightheaded.
Same - in fact, I found a nice meadow not far from where I live now. Every now and again, I'll spend the night there. For old time's sake.
What can I say? They were eye-catching. Consider me an art-lover.
Quite the understatement, but yes - I have it. And I'll guard it with my life.
Because it's important to my goddess. I was part of a group sent to claim the artefact in her name - and I'm the only survivor.
Because it just is. Trust breeds candour, so for now, that's all you need to know.
Then so be it - I did my duty. As for the artefact... it's powerful. And has a mind of its own sometimes. You'd better hope you're up to bearing it.
Don't forget what it was like, when you heard the voice. It'll only get worse if you don't have the artefact to protect you.
It's called faith. Duty. It doesn't have to add up to me so long as I serve. I'm part of a bigger plan - one that will be revealed in time.
I told you already - I surrendered my memories, for the sake of the mission.
Shar's secrets must be protected - duty demands it. Once I fulfil my mission, I can have my memories restored.
Because it's safer that way. We had our memories suppressed before the mission - that way, none of us could betray the Dark Lady if we were captured.
Don't worry, it's not information I share too casually. Besides, those murals looked old; the druids have more current troubles to worry about.
How cynical. I should borrow that line sometime. But if I have to die, so be it. Like I said - faith.
I get to return home. Shar is the only one who's ever offered me a place in this world. If I succeed, I'll be closer to her than ever.
Shar's favour is all the reward I need. She made a place for me where no one else would. If I succeed, I can return to it, and be even closer to her.
I was part of a group sent by my cloister. We were to take the artefact from the githyanki and bring it to Baldur's Gate, no matter the cost.
Though it turned out the cost was very steep. I was the only one of the group to survive - I took the artefact and fled... only to be ensnared by mind flayers before I could finish the mission.
I suppose if we're going to keep helping each other, I might as well tell you... I was part of a group sent to retrieve it, bring it to Baldur's Gate, for our goddess...
I worship Shar, the Mistress of the Night. It's my mission to deliver the artefact to her secret cloister in Baldur's Gate.
It's not the sort of thing I can just tell anyone. Let's see if we can build up some trust first.
Like I said before - it's not the sort of thing I can tell just anyone. Maybe with time... or maybe not.
It's reciprocal, trust me. We need each other... Once we're cured, well, our partnership can end, if that's what you wish.
But make no mistake - when the time comes, the artefact leaves with me.
That's not a luxury open to many people, us included. I have my faith to turn to instead. You should find something of your own.
The mural is propaganda - who is to say what truly happened. Though it is known that the Dark Justiciars have been silent for years.
Nobody knows what became of them. Perhaps the battle in the mural wiped them out... but I'm not so sure.
Curious, to see them depicted in such a place. Perhaps there is more to it... but there's nothing to be done about it just now.
Perhaps... but they could just as easily mean nothing. Those ruins seemed to be Sharran in nature - at least from what I could see at that distance.
If we're able to find a way to get closer later on, well, I'll be very interested in seeing what's down there.
I do. Remember the Dark Justiciars I told you about? I can't imagine those ruins are just a coincidence.
Speaking plainly, this isn't the first sign I've come across of a Sharran presence since we've been journeying together. I can't ignore them forever.
I do. If there's more worth sharing, you'll be the first to know. Trust me.
It might all be a coincidence... but between those ruins, and the signs I saw of Dark Justiciars before? It might be much more.
Not just yet - I wouldn't want to get my hopes up. If we can get any closer, and if there's anything more to that place, well... I think I'll have plenty to say then.
Perhaps not just any Sharran ruins... remember the Dark Justiciars I spoke of before? Might be a coincidence. Might not.
We've encountered other signs of a Sharran presence during our time together. I need to understand what it all means. Indulge me, if you can. Please.
Don't be nervous. I'll be there to protect you.
Just a useful landmark to get our bearings with. I'm not keen on taking wrong turns in the Underdark.
Everything, potentially. There is scarcely a greater way to fully dedicate yourself to Lady Shar - save perhaps if you become the head of her church.
To become a Dark Justiciar is to become the Nightsinger's sword arm - her implement with which she will cast down the unbelievers and win the final battle to restore her perfect, endless darkness...
It's all I ever wanted. I prayed it was my calling.
But 'Mother' forbid me from seeking to prove myself worthy of the rank. She said I was not ready.
They just reminded me of something half-forgotten... it seemed to depict Lady Shar's warriors in combat. I hadn't known they were active in these parts.
You know me. I'm not usually one to elaborate if I can avoid it.
Not formidable enough to win the battle, it seems. But still, worthy of my respect.
Once being a long time ago - those murals were hardly recent. I think we all have more current troubles to worry about.
They looked like Dark Justiciars - an elite force among Lady Shar's ranks. Only the very finest proved themselves worthy of the title.
What right-minded servant of Lady Shar wouldn't? But it's a distant dream - the Dark Justiciars have been silent for years.

There was a proving ground of sorts. A place where initiates sought to complete Lady Shar's trials, and make a sacrifice in her name. But that place is lost now. Some even wonder if it ever truly existed.
Still... to join their ranks would be an honour almost beyond measure. I can but dream...
You could say that... and yes, I still have it.
Often I think I feel her influence, when the wound pains me. Not even memories, just... glimpses, impressions. Perhaps the wound is her doing; something Lady Shar bid her to do. I don't know.
There's something I want to talk to you about. Something important.
Must there be? I've learned to live with it. It's fine, I swear.
Of course. From the first time I laid eyes on you, right until now. That's all safe - I wouldn't surrender even a moment of it.
I do. The Mother Superior will have ordered them to keep watch for my return. Find one, and we discover what comes next.
Not quite. Above all else, protecting our base of operations in Baldur's Gate was the reason I had to surrender my memories to begin with... or at least, that's what I was led to believe.
We should look for someone to point me in the right direction, otherwise we'll have little recourse but to wander the whole city, searching.
I know what you mean. And under different circumstances, I'd like that too. But first things first, I'm afraid.
Wyrm's Crossing is a chokepoint - if I wanted to intercept a new arrival, I'd find somewhere before the bridge, blend in amongst the crowds, and wait.
Most people seeking entry to the city will be refugees. I'd look wherever they're gathering.

Difficult to say. I've strayed from my original mission, but Lady Shar has given me a new one. Time will tell if my peers recognise that... the Mother Superior has a tight grip on them - one that I intend to break.
If by warm, you perhaps mean a flaming arrow? I doubt they'll attack in public. No, I expect they'll point me in the right direction so I can face my reckoning away from prying eyes.
It's overwhelming - like a lifetime's worth of nightmares, unleashed all at once upon waking. I can barely untangle one moment from another - not that I even want to.
I just know that my heart sinks if I let my thoughts wander to them...
Perhaps. But in the meanwhile, I'll just have to find a way to live with them.
Shar seeks to break people, to fill their lives with despair, so that they will turn to her for relief. Perhaps she thought this would lead me back to her in time...
But it won't. I fought too hard to win my freedom - I will not give it up again. No matter how much it hurts.
I spoke to my father already. It was difficult... but I think it helped. I'm better equipped to deal with my past now.
Yes... but it's not an easy subject to broach. Those bad memories... they're filled with my parents' faces, their cries of pain. But perhaps it will help, if I can clear the air...
That graffiti from before - I never thought I'd see it again...
Well... I think I was the one who did it.
I can recognise my own handwriting... how long ago was this? Years?
All the time I spent training, hidden away from the world. I think... I think I must have wanted to leave my mark somewhere - just to prove I existed. Even to myself...
It was to me - I think I was the one who did it.
The final sacrifice has been made. I am Lady Shar's right hand now. It has all been worth it - every step, every trial, every drop of blood...
None. She sealed her own fate - I was merely Lady Shar's instrument in delivering the final blow.

You've been with me all this time... you know exactly what I've sacrificed to achieve this. I had hoped you'd learned to not try and sour my relationship with Lady Shar, but clearly not. Let us speak no more of this.
I suppose we can manage that...
What in life isn't? I consider myself blessed to have a goddess guide my very mind.
Anything that's missing... well, I can't miss what I can't remember. I have all I need.
I... I think so, but I don't know why. That name on the tomb meant nothing to me, yet I felt a pang of loss all the same.
You'd be surprised - not all of us don robes and dark armour. Some people live perfectly normal lives on the surface, blending in utterly, so that they can serve the Dark Lady in utter secrecy.
And not every skill that the Dark Lady asks of her followers can be taught in the shadows. Some can only be mastered on the streets, in daylight, amidst crowds.
Lying, tailing, observing without being seen, picking a purse without being felt... I think I must have been sent to learn all these things from the man in that grave.
'Allister Marnley'. Sounds human, and the grave wasn't recent. He must have died some time ago. And I mourned him already.
He'd surely not have been buried here if he was exposed - he must have taken the secret of his faith to the grave, undiscovered. A very Sharran ending.
I think I knew that man. I think he helped me somehow, long ago, and I grieved when he died.
Not all of Sharrans don robes and dark armour. Some people live perfectly normal lives on the surface, blending in utterly, so that they can serve the Dark Lady in utter secrecy.
That's a question that could take a lifetime to answer. Lady Shar's followers are my responsibility now. I will need to guide them, and root out any heresy that Viconia sowed.
But all that must wait for now - the Nightsinger's church cannot thrive if the Absolute isn't stopped.
When the time comes for the final battle, Lady Shar's faithful will be ready. Until then, we should continue to do what we must.
I can very easily imagine I needed somewhere to escape to, if I was to survive.
Nocturne and I must have come here a lot. We probably had plenty we wanted to hide from.
I don't think I was always alone there either... I remembered a friend, when I ate the noblestalk. I think we hid from our troubles, together.
I have the strangest feeling that I wasn't always alone there... don't ask me why, but I almost sense the conversations, the laughter.
Perhaps I had an imaginary friend. Wouldn't surprise me.
Anyway, I think that little hideaway helped shape who I am, as much as any sermon or training did. Funny, the things that influence you...
Everything that's happened... Shar, my parents... it's almost too much to take in.
You probably would have been well-rewarded by her if you hadn't just told me that. I owe you.
I... I haven't had a chance to figure that part out just yet. What happened barely feels real to me. I had my family back, for such a short time... and now they're gone again.
Give me a night, to try and get my head together.
Those that are worth remembering, yes. Lady Shar is ever-wise; she knows what I do and do not have to know in order to be her most loyal, most effective servant:
My training knowledge, my experiences, my will and faith... everything I need to be leader of the cloister.
Not as much as I am. My whole life has been leading up to this. At last, I've become who I've always meant to be.
I'm afraid my gratitude is all I have to offer.
I'm afraid my gratitude is all I have to offer... and a kiss, of course.
But kind patron, I am but a humble cleric - all I have belongs to my goddess.
I have to be ready to pay any cost that Lady Shar asks of me. If that troubles you, I'm sorry. But it cannot be changed.
Let me guess... you're wondering why I was in pain before. Best if we just get the subject out of the way now...
The grove sported some rather interesting murals, I must say...
Something the matter? Wait -
A joyous little affliction that visits me with screaming agony on occasion. I'd be lying if I told you I know what causes it...
But don't worry - it can't hurt you. Only me.
Worse. But it passes quickly. Usually.
I know that look - you're wondering why I was in pain before. Let's just clear the air about that now.
There's something I've been wanting to share with you, if now's a good time...
Wouldn't you be, in my place? If there's even the slightest chance that Shar worshippers remain within our reach, we should try and find them.
Even if they're all long gone - and that seems quite likely from what we know - who knows what they might have left behind for us to use?
My people are nothing if not resourceful.
Of course - we need every advantage we can grasp, and this Dark Justiciar stronghold sounds like an opportunity to me. We should look for it.
Perhaps they're still down there somewhere, but if not, who knows what they might've left behind for us to claim?
Shar worshippers are nothing if not resourceful, I hear.
I was. He mentioned Dark Justiciars, and we've come across other signs of a Sharran presence during our travels. I'm not sure I can dismiss that as a coincidence.
I seem to recall fragments of tales about them - their prowess in battle, their unshakeable faith. I thought they were the stuff of legends. Perhaps not.
The wound on my hand. It never quite heals, and sometimes it causes terrible pain to rip through me. It's my burden though, from Lady Shar. I can feel her influence, somehow...
I'll try my best. But secrecy is ingrained in me. Lady Shar considers it greater protection than any shield or armour.
I cannot say - not with what I can recall. But even then, it would not be for me to question her will. Lady Shar has her reasons.
It's difficult to say... sometimes I wonder if it's supposed to be guiding me, punishing me, testing me... but perhaps it's none of those. Perhaps it's completely random.
I'd like to hope there's more to it than that - some meaning that Lady Shar will reveal to me, when the time is right. Until then, all I can do is endure.
It's less difficult than you might imagine, when you can't remember life without it.
Perhaps you're right... but there's little we can do about it just now. Maybe a way will present itself in time, if Lady Shar wills it.
I don't think so, but you're sweet to ask. Maybe just be patient the next time you see me wince or cry out - it'll pass quickly enough. It always does.
Everyone has to suffer - it's a fact of life. Until Lady Shar deems it is time. I know you mean well, but this is not something for you to fix.
Pain is the gauntlet that all who love Lady Shar must endure. Only her embrace can truly heal me.
There is scarcely a greater way to fully dedicate yourself to Lady Shar - save perhaps if you become the head of her church.
Not my mother-mother, I should add. The Mother Superior. Head of Lady Shar's enclave in Baldur's Gate.
Sometimes I wonder if she would ever deem me ready. I owe her everything, and I only wish to serve, yet she can prove... inscrutable.

I don't know. Perhaps if I succeed in my mission, and reach Baldur's Gate. Hope has little place amongst Lady Shar's children - it is an illusion, a distraction. But for this... I hope my time will yet come.
Dark Justiciars are hated by many - judged to be ruthless fanatics. Even the few who would accept a follower of Lady Shar would likely baulk at a Justiciar in their midst.
But there's a simpler answer to your question - I simply forgot about the desire I had, until I saw some things that reminded me. Now I can't get it out of my mind.
Fine, it can keep for a while yet.
Yes. There's one more thing I wanted to share about myself. Something I think you deserve to know.
It's difficult to put into words... I think it might be easier to just show you.
Use the tadpole - the connection. Come into my mind.
I'm sure. I trust you.
How I came to be who I am. How I found my way to Lady Shar's embrace.
That's all I remember.
She made me who I am... at least, as best as I can remember. She taught me, trained me, punished me when I failed her - which was often.
Perhaps I was. She sent me on this mission, after all.
No doubt she feels the same way.
You're reading too much into things - a childhood bauble, that's all.
Just because Sel√ªnites claim something, doesn't mean they own it.
Normally I'd agree, but with you... it's getting easier by the moment.
I don't remember how it started. Only how it ended. I was fleeing.
No... the opposite. I feel like I can share this with you. I've never felt that way before.
Honestly? Trust. I can't remember the last time I sought to confide in someone like this - maybe I never have, for all I know. But now it just feels... right.
Fine, if you insist.
Perhaps you're right... and perhaps one day I won't have to suffer. But I don't think that day has arrived yet. Lady Shar will ease my pain, when she wishes to.
Still, I learned much from the late Mother Superior. It was the least I could do to make that final blow a swift one.
Pain is sacred to followers of Lady Shar. Pain will give way to loss, and then to the peace of her eternal darkness. You can tolerate a great deal of suffering, so long as it has meaning.
It's nothing to do with the tadpoles at least, in case your imagination is in danger of getting away from you.
I suppose I owe you my thanks - unlikely I'd have found this without you leading the way.
That structure we saw from a distance, in the Grymforge. Something about it struck me as noteworthy.
Perhaps we'll find an easier way to reach it, if we keep pressing forward.
I... I can't. My memories are being withheld for a reason. Lady Shar will return them to me when the time is right. No sooner.
Besides, mushrooms aren't my favourite. I think it's because of the gills...
All right... give it here.
I remember... something. Not everything. It's new and not new at the same time, all jumbled up.
I was younger. Much younger. An initiate at the cloister. I was upset about something... the others were teasing me. Mocking my name. Like I wasn't worthy of it...
There was another. A tiefling boy with short horns and purple hair. I think he was my friend. He tried to make me feel better...
'Rennald'. That's the last part of it I remember... that must be his name. Perhaps he's still there, in Baldur's Gate.
I think so. I remember... something. Not everything. It's new and not new at the same time, all jumbled up.
I've given my answer - I'm not eating that thing. Go sell it, or make an omelette with it, for all I care.
What's your game, exactly? A Sel√ªnite bearing gifts sounds like a trick if I ever heard one.
You sound troublingly sincere... but thank you. I'll find this a place of honour at camp.
I suppose civility never killed anyone... well that's not true, but thank you. I'll find a place of honour...
You're no such thing. But I'm still keeping this... thank you.
Easily done. How am I ever going to explain this in my prayers...?
You... you thought of me? Thank you, it's beautiful. I'll find a place of honour for it in camp.
Nobody's ever given me anything before. What do I owe you in return?
Thank you. Lady Shar teaches us to forswear material goods... but I think she'll make an exception for her own image.
Well, in that case, thank you. I'll always think of you when I look upon it - after I think of Lady Shar, of course.
But kind sir, I am but a humble cleric - all I have belongs to my goddess.
But kind madam, I am but a humble cleric - all I have belongs to my goddess.
Perhaps I'm just grasping at straws... but I should keep watch for more signs.
It's just an old wound that hurts me from time to time. Nothing to be concerned about.
This isn't the first sign we've come across. It can't just be a coincidence - they had a presence in these lands once. I should keep watch for more signs.
Thank you. I should have known you'd be understanding.
It's just... something I have to live with.
Quite a lot, if I'm being honest. But it always passes quickly, so I can manage.
Positive. You can trust me on that.
I'm sure.
I know. I felt it.
I felt it go from me to you. You need its help, just as it needs us - it's still just a box, after all.
You wouldn't have been able to take it. The artefact has a will of its own - it'd fight back if it didn't want to be with you.
Might not be possible. It's stubborn that way - prone to lashing out. Keep it for now - we can all help to protect it.
The other way around, more like. The artefact goes with whom it wishes, and lashes out at anyone who tries to take it. Keep it for now - we can all help to protect it.
But make no mistake - when the time comes, when we're cured - the artefact leaves with me.
The best I can do is stay close, bide my time... eventually I'll need to take it. Then I'll have to see what can be done about that.
Don't be - it can't harm you. And as for me? Well... I'm used to it.
Don't be. It's nothing to do with you.
I told you already - it's none of your concern.
There's no story. None that you're entitled to hear, anyway. Just forget you ever saw it.
It's not easily understood, in my experience. But I'll try.
Apologies. I was less than forthcoming when you asked before. You didn't know about my faith - I wasn't sure how you'd react.
Just an old wound that hurts every now and again. No need to make a fuss.
Of course - I couldn't leave such a treasure behind. I'll find it a place of honour in the camp.
I suppose I owe you thanks. I hadn't expected a Sel√ªnite to lead me to such a beautiful piece. You're full of surprises.
In any case, it was certainly not what I expected to find in the Underdark.
I wonder... perhaps this is connected to the Dark Justiciars.
This is no coincidence, I'm sure of it. I need to keep an eye out for more signs - learn more about the Justiciars' presence in these lands. It could be important.
Why, thank you. Always nice to have you to tell me what is and isn't worthwhile.
As long as I've prayed to Lady Shar, I've wished to serve her as a Dark Justiciar.
She is alone and powerless. Lady Shar has denounced her, and her own followers have abandoned her. Perhaps she will come to regret her survival, but either way, I do not expect to see her again.
Nocturne has endured much in this place, and remained loyal to me. Once I have settled into my role, I shall see that whatever place she desires in Lady's Shar's service is hers.
I understand. Feel free to have your fun. Perhaps I'll have mine.
I'm glad that understanding's been noticed. Hasn't always been the case with others, trust me.
Deny yourself then. Just remember that I'm not the obstacle.
Was there anything else, besides your increasingly complex love life?
Are you sure? He's large, granted. But I can squeeze in any number of places.
If you have a chance to climb Mount Halsin, well I'd be cruel to deny you. I'll be waiting to hear the details afterwards.
Must we? No harm in a little mystery, don't you think?
I should hope not. Have you ever heard the people who want to talk about themselves? I'm doing you a favour.
Sweet of you... but don't worry - I'm sure you'll get to know me just fine by travelling together. No need for interrogations just yet.
Say for a moment that I was. Do you think your blunt approach would get me to confess?
My. You must find the city very appealing to be making those sorts of noises out in public...
Good. I like you - and you did save my life. I wouldn't want to sour things between us - not while we need each other.
A shame you feel that way. Just don't expect me to entertain your questions if you won't respect my privacy
Thank you. I'm sure we'll get along perfectly well.
Easier's often less interesting. Besides, we've plenty of reason to rely on each other already - you can't confide in just anyone about a monster in your head.
Conversation shouldn't be made - it should be grown. Let the seeds sprout in their own time.
I suppose you've noticed I'm not terribly fond of wolves...
Of course - but remember. Lady Shar comes first.
You could fill several volumes with all that's happened to us. Perhaps the reminiscing should wait until the day is won... or not.
Hard to fathom really... all the way from that pod, through the wilds, and finally back to where it started for me.
It'll make for quite a bedtime tale for the children, if you ever get me in a family way.
It'll make quite a bedtime tale for the children - if I survive to have any, that is.
Good. I like you - I wouldn't want to sour things between us. Not while we need each other.
Of course. In the spirit of open-mindedness. I want to hear it all.
I'm sure. Have your fun. Perhaps I'll have mine.
... luckily for you, I don't count among their number. If you have a chance to climb Mount Halsin, well I'd be cruel to deny you. I'll be waiting to hear the details afterwards.
She is my Mother. She nurtures me, cares for me, loves me.
But you know all this of course. Only a pity that more don't reject the Sel√ªnites' lies.
There's less truth in the moon witch's teachings than you've been led to believe, Sel√ªnite.
Don't believe the lies the Sel√ªnites tell.
What, besides my life's calling and the greatest problem I've ever faced...?
Careful. Stealing the most precious item in this place is hardly going to go unnoticed...
Well... I like night orchids and can't swim. Is that the sort of thing you meant?
It's a deal.
It's nothing to laugh at. Save your questions if that's how you're going to react.
No. I can't.
Quite literally, I mean. With my memories suppressed, I can't betray Shar's secrets... but I can't remember much of myself either.
I mean... I literally can't. There's certain things I can't remember right now.
You're the same as me. You know how important Shar's secrets are.
Shar's secrets must be preserved above all else. All who worship her know this.
I have had certain memories suppressed - voluntarily - so that I can serve Shar without compromising her.
Careful. I doubt Raphael's associates dispense pleasures of the flesh out of charity. There's bound to be a catch.
If I manage to return to Baldur's Gate and fulfil Shar's mission... then my memories will be restored.
That is not for me to share, even to a fellow child of Shar.
That is not for you to know. Leave it at that.
I do as Shar asks of me. You would have done the same, I'm sure.
Of course. It is an act of faith - not to be undertaken lightly. Shar will reward me, when I succeed.
You're talking about Halsin, aren't you? I don't blame you. It'd take a cold heart and cobwebbed loins to ignore him. But what exactly did you have in mind?
Bold of you to ask. Some might take the suggestion very badly...
Honestly, I'm still surprised that we actually managed to defeat Ketheric Thorm. Perhaps a final victory isn't such a wild dream after all...
I'm not sure I can even think about that right now... I'm still wrapping my mind around what happened in the Shadowfell...
Lady Shar has chosen me. Words can't convey how I feel. All I know is that I must prove her faith in me to be well-placed...
You're the author of your own tale now - well done.
Thank you. And you're right, it's... a delicate matter. Not something for light conversation.
Home. Baldur's Gate.
If you must know, Baldur's Gate.
We go our separate ways, of course - what else? The ties that bind would be well and truly severed.
We were brought together by circumstance. Besides, I have my own people in Baldur's Gate.
And before you ask, no. I'm not telling you what I'm doing there, or who I'm meeting, or anything else.
You pry too much. Any further, and you'll regret it, understand?
No notes. You've exceeded my every expectation.
Even if I could have made it this far without you, I don't think I'd have wanted to.
Considering all we've been through, I think I was very lucky to find such favourable company. And attractive company too, no less.
Quite splendidly to give credit where it's due. You and I have shared some good times together, and it seems we have plenty in common...
You're a better catch than I'd expected to find while fighting for survival in the wilderness.
And think of how far we've come together - all the ways from the Hells, back to civilisation.
We've already made great strides - both in distance travelled, and in more personal matters...
You're someone I can actually turn to, when I don't know what to do.
Trust isn't something that comes easily to me. But with you... I think I can make an exception.
I don't think I've ever had a confidante quite like you - and if I have, I can't remember them.
I opened up to you like I have with no one before. We bonded... but it's been downhill from there. Perhaps we can rekindle things, or perhaps not...
Careful what you do with that thing...
But I won't give up on you - not just yet. I'm my own worst enemy in that regard.
I tried to wrest you from Bhaal's grip once already. Seems I failed.

Twice over, in fact. You supported me against Lae'zel. I may not have survived that night without you.
I already opened up to you before - shared some of the crumbs of memory that I can still lay claim to.
I am not going to offer apologies for doing as I was commanded to.
Take care - I'll be here when you need me.
I've seen them at work before. I wasn't alone in my mission - all those who were sent with me were slain by githyanki blades.
All will be revealed in due time. I hope.
But what about Karlach? You'd break her heart just to be with me?
But what about Gale? Are you seriously suggesting you'd cut ties with him, to be with me...?
I won't lie... I feel a little sorry for him. But only a little bit.
You'd truly end things with Wyll to be with me...?
But what about Astarion? Losing you could nudge him to a dark path. Are you truly willing to sacrifice what you have with him, for me...?
Well, I'm flattered you care enough about me to have doubts... but we both know where your heart truly lies.
Well that's one way to end things.
I hope this is important.
You know, just because I join you at your bedroll from time to time doesn't mean you need to talk to me quite so much. Is this urgent?
Personality isn't everything, I suppose. Plenty of relationships can limp along on physical attraction alone. What do you want?
I can't blame you. Who wouldn't want a hero of the classic mould for a lover - and heir to a noble house, to boot?
In truth, I don't think I'd want to be your spare lover. I'd always want more of you than you'd have to spare. Better perhaps to bow out with dignity.
Ugh, I have to say I'm feeling rather worn out lately, Astarion. Curious...
Careful. I'd hate to spoil the moment by stabbing you.
I can think of at least one place it could go.
Perhaps later,  when we're alone...
Are you trying to make me blush? I think it might just be working...
I wished I shared your confidence.
They must want that artefact back badly, if they're dispatching red dragons in pursuit of it. But we cannot afford to lose it.
I wish I'd never been sent on this mission. It had better be worth it.
You'll have to live with that curiosity for now, I'm afraid. Let's just concentrate on ridding ourselves of these tadpoles.
Stay ignorant then. Just don't compromise me.
True enough.
I've seen them at work before. I wasn't alone in my mission - all those who were sent with me were slain by your peoples' blades.
Of course, I'll see you in the evenings. Stay safe out there.
Very well. I do like it here, truth be told; my own little corner, time to think... but I'll be ready when you need me. Take care.
Take care. I'll keep an eye on this place.
Rubbish.
A Sel√ªnite book. I'm almost surprised that lot can read, never mind write.
Sel√ªnite. Strange, seeing  such an item in a new light.
Sel√ªne. Fit only for a rubbish pile.
Moonwitch rubbish. Ought to be burned.
Sel√ªnite. I would have looked on this with scorn, once...
Strange. I would have scoffed at such a thing, once.
I would have destroyed this in Shar's name once. But no longer.
Hardly even worth selling.
Was anything I was taught about Sel√ªne true...?
Hmmph. Sel√ªnite detritus.
Of the moonwitch. Ought to be burned.
Sel√ªnite. Strange... once, I would have been repelled. Now, I don't know.
Sel√ªnite. Once my enemy, now the enemy of my enemy...
Sometimes I still catch myself scoffing at anything Sel√ªnite... old habits die hard.
Sel√ªnite. An offence to the eyes.
I'm not afraid of wolves any more - spare me your cheap tricks!
Wolves...? No, anything but wolves...
Keep away from me!
Not another one.
No. Anything but a wolf...
Everyone's frightened of something. My fear's hardly irrational, when you see the fangs on those things.
Blasted wolves. They always make me feel like that scared little girl all over again...
A Sel√ªnite book. Perhaps I should actually heed her words, for a change.
She asked me my name. I can't remember what I said. I can't remember anything before those woods. All I know is she saved my life, and gave me a new home. With Lady Shar.
Curious, seeing a book of Sel√ªne and not wanting to immediately rip it up...
Imagine wasting your time actually reading this tripe.
Imagine turning on those who love you for you own glory...
Don't worry, I'll fix you up.
It's all right, I'll take care of you.
'Fabian ran his calloused fingers along Allura's scales. Her tail quivered in response...'
You fight well. Perhaps our survival isn't such a distant prospect.
Do that again, and I'll kill you. That's your one and only warning - understand?
Good. Don't test me on this - I'm deadly serious.
Oh, let her stay. What's the worst that could happen?
You don't get to decide that. Keep your hands to yourself.
You should have listened.
You should've kept your hands to yourself.
Strange... I would have been compelled to defile this shrine once. But no longer.
Dedicated to Sel√ªne. A place where fools kneel, then.
A waste of artisanship.
Oh don't be such a killjoy. What's the worst that could happen?
She may not be much of an asset, but I doubt she'll be a hindrance. Let her stay.
Safer to keep her here than blundering around by herself - wouldn't want her accidentally leading the wrong sort of attention to us.
Sel√ªne... had life turned out differently, I might have been kneeling in prayer here.
I don't know what I'm supposed to feel about Sel√ªne now. I was fed lies for so long...
It must take a truly feeble mind to raise such a dedication to Sel√ªne.
More moonwitch nonsense.
It would have been heresy to even consider reading this, once. No more.
A Sel√ªnite book. Fit only for the pyre.
Sel√ªnite. I would have burned this, once.
I'll patch you up.
Shadowheart...
To serve. To repent.
I want to talk to you about the other night. I thought we were having a pleasant time... but you cut it short.
Ah - so that's what people mean when they talk about butterflies in their stomach. Did you want something?
You know, I've been catching myself smiling more lately. I think that's your fault.
I was hoping you'd come to chat. What do you need?
Well, my day just improved. Did you want something?
Aren't you a sight for sore eyes.
Did you want something? If not, I'm perfectly happy to just gaze upon you a while.
Why hello, lover... that sounded more debonaire in my head, I'll admit. Do you need something?
Good. I was just starting to miss the sound of your voice.
I truly wouldn't have faulted you if you wanted Karlach. Those arms are built to sweep someone off their feet.
Lady Shar has given me a new mission - and the Prism plays no part in it. In fact, it seems like the Mother Superior's concern alone, and she has strayed from the Dark Lady.
She will be in for a rude awakening when I finally stand before her again...
But I digress. Did you want something?
I do not serve Shar anymore. Nor the Mother Superior. The Prism is no longer my mission - saving my parents is.
I do not serve Shar anymore. Nor the Mother Superior. The Prism is no longer my mission. Only the Nightsong can tell me what I must do next.
Something the matter?
The Chamber of Loss beckons. Lady Shar has one final task for me, then all of this will be mine.
My parents are still captive. I need to free them.
I suppose we didn't. Another life perhaps.
If you're sure... though you seem to know what you're doing, I suppose.
If you're sure...
You mind yourself out there, understand? I'll be here when you need me.
All right. Be good out there - and if you can't be good, well... don't get caught. I'll be here whenever you need me.
I don't think there'll be any more trouble between Lae'zel and I, if you were wondering. We can all sleep easier now - well, apart from all the rest.
Returned. Punished. My mission failed...
You know, we had the beginnings of something special once... but it was not meant to be, I suppose. Perhaps happiness lies elsewhere, for both of us.
I don't answer to you - move along.
No...
To serve Lady Shar...
I felt it. It didn't want to stay with me... I failed...
Cleric...
It is forbidden...
A secret. My mission. Must keep it safe...
Protect the artefact. Deliver to Baldur's Gate...
Cannot. Must not. Too important...
Baldur's Gate...
On me. Always in reach...
I... I defied Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
I was convinced Lae'zel was had settled on you as her conquest. Brave of you to deny her.
You're a sight for sore eyes, even now. Did you want something?
What can I do for you?
You know, I didn't realise it was possible to be so cordial with a former flame. I suppose I'm lucky. Did you want something?
Careful - keep seeking me out like this and people may think we're rekindling things. Did you want something?
Hmm. You wanted something?
In need of attention, I take it?
Oh, you're back.
Sometimes I wonder if I should just let the tadpole dictate my love life. Did you want something?
I... I failed. I failed Lady Shar. She won't stand for this... we can talk later - I need to get out of here first.
That's one way to put it - careful she doesn't try to steal it to replace her own. But in all seriousness, I'm glad you found someone, even if it isn't me. I hope you make each other happy.
I admire your ambition - and your belief in your own stamina - but Karlach deserves to have you to herself. And perhaps there's yet someone out there for me...
You know, we had the beginnings of something special once... but it was not meant to be, I suppose. For the best perhaps - I have to dedicate myself to Lady Shar now.
I must admit, you've been a surprise, and not an unpleasant one. Kindred spirits are few and far between for me.
Personally, I think finding this 'Halsin' is our best bet.
You're not the kind of company I'd keep willingly, but all things considered... you'll do.
We should make this a tradition - meet up every year.
I'll admit it - I miss the sounds of the wilderness at night. You simply don't get that in the city.
Almost a shame we didn't throw more parties, come to think of it. After felling Ketheric Thorm perhaps? We even had an inn at our disposal. And a brewery...
My Lady truly shows her splendour on nights like these...
Oh no, this is far more sophisticated. It has layers.
Ha! Not quite...
I'm unappreciated in my time.
Come on, oink like a pig and boink - oh you know what I mean!
Oh come on, you loved it. I'll wager I'll overhear you telling that to someone else before the night is out.
My, you'll make the others jealous if you spend much more time with me.
Why thank you.
Oh... what did the amorous boar say to the sow?
Hmm... let me see...
Oh fine, if it gets you to crack a smile.
Not with that sort of attitude, I don't.
You might be on to something there... though the name might need work. Somehow it sounds rude, even though I know otherwise.
I suppose it's worth a try - it might keep the animals amused for a while.
I've missed wine. Had to resort to making my own cider recently - which isn't bad, don't get me wrong - but a girl can't have fun with apples alone.
You're sweet, but don't worry. After all we've been through, this will be a breeze... just don't leave me alone for too long.
Oh, I've noticed. Ever since I first slipped into my camp garments, I should think.
'Fancy a b-oink?'
I hope the sand takes its time slipping through the hourglass - I don't want tonight to end too soon.

You know, I never really imagined Withers as much of a party-thrower, but then again I suppose our camps weren't taking care of themselves while we were out gallivanting, were they? There's hidden depths in that loveable husk.
Indeed - healing can only do so much. We'd likely be dead somewhere out in the wilderness if not for him.
Even once all that is done, more will be asked of me, no doubt. The holy work will not be done until the Nightsinger's eternal darkness is restored.
There is one other matter. As the Chosen of Lady Shar, it is time to carry myself like one.
I still carry certain vestiges of a novice. That will no longer do. If I am to lead in Lady Shar's name, I must look the part.
Leave it to me - you'll see exactly what I mean, soon enough.
Not just what I like - what Lady Shar demands of me.
Don't worry. It's nothing that will bring you harm.
I could get lost in those arms.
Hard to imagine there was a time when I didn't have you to hold me.
You'll have me addicted to these embraces, do you know that?
One hug is never enough, is it?
I hope there's more where that came from.
You could charge gold for hugs, you know. They'd be queuing over the horizon.
You've already pestered me with your notions once today. If I have something to add, I'll tell you.
This again? You're persistent, I'll give you that.
I'm not sure I'd agree, but very well. What do you want to know?
What, Shar's tenets? If you like...
Blessed Nightsinger, witness our adoration. See how we serve you, only you.
We have emptied our hearts of falsehoods. We have vanquished your foes. In the darkness, we see your truth.
Embrace us, your loyal warriors. Cloak us in your shadow. Guide us to your victory.
Shar's will shall be done. As sure as night will fall.
Oh no, that's all part of the fun! You know me - I can't resist a bit of mystery.
Anyway, I know it's real. I know we made it. I just wish I could go back in time and reassure the old me that it would all work out. But enough introspection - this is a party.
Save it for when we're alone.
They're our friends, dear. Let's spill nothing but wine tonight.
Hmm, I hope that doesn't extend to me as well. But so long as your silver tongue is the only part of your mouth you put to use tonight.
The owlbear?!
We'll have to find somewhere for him to sleep, of course - he'd get stuck in the door of the cottage. Maybe the barn? It's as warm as anywhere, as long as he gets along with the other animals...
I can picture the look on my parents' faces already...
Well now we're going to have to do that, aren't we? You're a bad influence, you know.
We'll have to find somewhere for him to sleep, of course - he'd get stuck in the door of the cottage. Maybe the barn? It's as warm as anywhere, as long as he gets along with Daphne.
Of course he can come with us! I always regretted we didn't extend the offer after the battle - it was all such a blur...
You didn't!
Oh did you now? Come on then - out with it...
Perhaps I'll shoo the cats out of our room and scatter copper pieces over the bed some evening, and we can play make-believe.
That sounds fun. Why haven't we been doing that?
Just that. Off you go.
Much better. Now off you go.
Ahem.
Have fun - just don't wear yourself out too quickly. I'm anticipating a long night ahead of us.
Are you trying to make me sleepy? You know how easily I get lost in your arms.
Why, I feel better already.
You'll seize any opportunity, won't you? But I suppose I've been giving your plenty of encouragement...
But enough about Shar and her petty barbs - we're here to see old friends and enjoy ourselves, so let's do just that.
Perhaps. I won't get my hopes up just yet, but in truth, it doesn't matter. Her plan failed - I'm happy. I mean, how could I not be? I have you.
She'd probably break out in hives.
It's fine - already passed. Shar must have sensed I was enjoying myself.

So, we should divvy up what we tell people about what we've been doing these past few months - I'd hate to be a bore that comes along and regurgitates the same story to someone moments after you've told them. Any ideas?
Lady Shar's church in Baldur's Gate has yet to be cleansed. A rot has set in amongst the leadership - one that I must cut out.
All about you, of course. 'Hells or not, every day's an adventure when I'm at Karlach's side', I'll tell them.
All about you, of course. 'Every day's an adventure when I'm at my love Gale's side', I'll tell them.
Always a popular choice.
Naturally. There's not many positives I can acknowledge about the Hells, but it is good for anecdote fodder.
Who knew smiling and waving could be so much work?
I suppose I can talk about playing the philanthropic duchess, touring the streets and winning the hearts of the masses.
Of course. You know, I think it was your self-confidence that made me fall for you to begin with - that, and that adorable earring of yours.
A touch bloodthirsty for party talk, no? But I suppose people like that sort of thing.
Heh, I was thinking the same of you. You pick me up whenever I'm down - often literally.
You're right. Your mere presence alone will leave them awed - just like when I first clapped eyes on you.
Oh come here and pay the tax, silly.
That's more like it.
Forgetting something?
Don't get into trouble - but if you must, fetch me first.
With music in the air and wine flowing? Oh I think I'll manage.
Mmm. I could get lost in those arms.
Why, are you expecting to be gone for long? All right...
Almost a shame we're with company - I'd be tempted to let you whisk me away someplace quiet.
That can be arranged...
I'm sure we'll have them hanging off our every word. I'll leave you to do some mingling, unless you need anything else?

Well, there's the visit to the House of the Moon, fending off Sharran assassins, that stray imp that joined us - Bing Bong, wasn't it? We've squeezed a lot - and I'm glad I got to share it all with you.
All about you, of course. 'Every day is an adventure when I'm fighting at Lae'zel's side', I'll tell them.
All about you, of course. 'Every day - or night - is an adventure when I'm at my paramour Astarion's side', I'll tell them.
All about you, of course. 'Every day's an adventure when I'm at my beloved Wyll's side', I'll tell them.

True. I wonder if anyone will be interested to hear the stories they told me of my youngest years. It's still strange to think of this whole other childhood I had before Shar. Almost like it's some other little girl...
She has - and I must continue to prove myself worthy of her favour. The apostate Ketheric Thorm still lives. That will soon change, if I have any say in the matter.
And her church in Baldur's Gate has been cleansed - Viconia strayed too far, and convinced herself that she knew better than the Nightsinger. The arrogance.
A night orchid - remember I told you they were my favourite? I'm lucky to have found one - perhaps it's a good omen for us.
He's trouble - worse, he's a traitor. Whatever loyalty he had towards Lady Shar is long gone. It would please her greatly to see him meet his long-overdue end, I'll wager.
I... I thought I was done for. I thought perhaps I might have been dead.
This... this is all like some sort of terrible dream. But it's real, isn't it? I stood before the Nightsong. I heard Lady Shar's words... and I failed her.
Worse than failed her - I defied her. Just because of what that aasimar said.
I tried to leave... but Shar blocked me. Punished me for failing her. I thought I knew the limit of pain that the incurable wound could inflict, but I had no idea.
It felt like I was suffering the agony of a thousand people, all at once. My blood was boiling, my hair was on fire. I thought I'd claw my own face off with the pain...
But then she released me - banished me more like. She said I was an outcast, that all of her children would know me and revile me. I'm alone.
Thank you. I needed that.
She may have offered me some protection from her shadows, but that doesn't extend to you. Easier for me to serve her if I still have you at my side.
I suppose I do, don't I? You've done more to help me than my faith has in recent times, if I'm honest. Thank you.
I thought my faith was the most important thing in my life - I couldn't have been more wrong.
I've squandered too much time already. I want to be with you. Now and always. Do you want the same?
It wasn't too long ago that I could never imagine smiling again... shows what I know.
Oh... then I'm sorry to have put you on the spot. Clearly I've a habit of seeking love in all the wrong places...
Live with it? For a time, at least. Anyone who bows to the Dark Lady could turn on me the moment they see me. I'm a target.
Nightsong promised she'd tell me something about myself. I need to speak with her as soon as I can.
What she said to me back in the Shadowfell, about the wolves... that's no coincidence.
She took flight to hunt down Ketheric Thorm. All I can do is help hasten his demise, and hope that answers soon follow.
Heh. Thank you. You're a constant source of comfort.
There's been something between us for some time. A connection, more than friends... I recognised it, but didn't act on it.
That blessing you accepted - Lady Shar won't like it, but I have to hope she'll understand it was a necessary evil.
Allowed? More like tolerated. But I thought it wiser to swallow my misgivings and keep focused.
Yet it was just a reminder of who I truly serve. I am still loyal to Lady Shar, and she will still offer me protection from some of her power.
Huh. That was... actually rather comforting. Thank you.
When I shared the memory from my childhood, you found it far too easy to make a connection to Sel√ªne for my liking.
I've always felt like I owed Lady Shar my life... but what came before? Why was I in those woods?
Thinking about my wound... it can't just be random, how it torments me. Surely there's a pattern, a purpose...
The pain is something I can handle. Well... most of the time.
True prayer needs peace. And serenity has proved elusive of late...
Normally, I'd tell you you're just reading too much into things. But, well...
I've done it. I've actually done it. A Dark Justiciar, chosen by Lady Shar. It almost doesn't feel real...
The long-overdue death of Ketheric Thorm.
I must continue to prove myself worthy of her favour. The apostate Ketheric Thorm still lives. That will soon change, if I have any say in the matter.
Not as glad as I am.
Well, it appears my days of seeking her approval are at an end.
Just my luck to enter a place where Lady Shar's power holds sway, only to find a Sel√ªnite stronghold in its midst.
I suppose that cleric, Isobel, must seem impressive to you - wielding Sel√ªnite magic, resisting Lady Shar's darkness...
That cleric, Isobel - she seems almost impressive, in a perverse sort of way. I didn't think anyone could resist Lady Shar's power like she does.
And please - the less said about her blessing, the better. That was for your benefit, and to keep the peace.
I do.
You think so? Thank you. I felt meek, like I'd failed the Dark Lady... but it's important to choose the right time to fight her battles.
Sel√ªnite presence here is an affront to Lady Shar, but this is not the time to do anything about it. We have bigger concerns.
Perhaps they might have done, if I was a lesser servant of the Nightsinger - one given to rash action.
Pleased? Hardly. I felt the bite of the wound right after the moon witch's influence was forced upon me.
You're lucky to have such confidence. Me... I think the full price of what I've done has yet to reveal itself. I'm a target to Lady Shar's followers now.
When Nightsong mentioned wolves, I felt my heart freeze. She knows things about me. She has the answer, and I don't even know the question yet.
Besides, you saved my life aboard the nautiloid. How can I do anything but sing your praises?
Until I hear what Nightsong has to say for herself, I simply won't know if I've ruined everything for no reason.
Don't be concerned. Perhaps she'll present you with an opportunity to prove yourself. If I can find myself in her graces, you must have at least an equal chance.
The darkness is the truth, Sel√ªnite. In the end, there will only be endless black, and those that Lady Shar has embraced.
Cling to your torches and memories of the sun if you like - see how long you last without me.
This is no cavern - this is true darkness. Perhaps Lady Shar will show you a path to her embrace, if you are worthy.
I suspected that might have been the case, but there was no harm in being cautious. And besides, now you know
Yes, you probably should have. Perhaps your moonwitch's guidance isn't as revealing as you believe it to be.
Why? Safety, discretion, to keep us focused... need I go on?
In any case, we can talk about it later. It's the protection I have that matters right now.
I worship Shar, the Dark Lady, Mistress of the Night. Though honestly I'm surprised you didn't figure it out by yourself already...
And this means I must have her blessing. Lady Shar is protecting me where others are left to face her wrath.
I wanted to talk to you about that. Lady Shar has bestowed a great honour upon me... but it isn't without a cost, it seems.
I... I don't want to, but Lady Shar demands it. Everything is surrendered to her, ultimately. But she claims some things earlier than others, it seems.

Perhaps we'll still be able to find a way. Some interpretation of her will that let's us stay together. But I can't guarantee anything, and I suspect that she'll demand more and more of me, as time passes.
If you don't want to gamble on that, I understand. You'll have little trouble finding a more straightforward lover, I suspect.
Are you sure? I don't want you to resent my divided affections...
You mean a lot to me - it would be cruel to mislead you. Now what is it to be...?
Then I can only hope Lady Shar will prove lenient if I try to keep a little piece of my heart from her...
As will I. Lady Shar may have honoured me, but I think it was you who changed me.
If you're truly sure. I'm not even certain myself...
No, I can remain with you as an ally if nothing else, but beyond that, I'm not sure how much I can promise you.
Indeed. And already I have seen to some of her holy work - the apostate Ketheric Thorm is dead. He stole Lady Shar's powers to extend his profane life. No more.
I... I don't know. I'm sorry. It's not for me to guess what value Lady Shar places on each servant.
There will be more for me to do, no doubt. The holy work will not be done until the Nightsinger's eternal darkness is restored.
The Shadowfell, her domain, has power here. Whatever the Dark Lady needs of me, I'll wager the answer lies wherever her power is strongest. I need to find that place, and see what awaits me.
Have you ever heard of the Dark Justiciars? They were Lady Shar's most elite warriors. I can't explain why, but something about this reminds me of them.
Be honest... what do you think of the new look?
I thought I knew who I was... but I was wrong. I do not belong to Shar, and I do not want to be adorned like one of her puppets any longer.
You came to mind as well. I remembered that night, when you resisted your impulses, turned away from what was demanded of you.
I thought perhaps that if you could take a step towards the light, then I could try as well.
You came to mind as well. You turned from your queen, and found new purpose. I thought perhaps I might be able to do the same.
The hair is just a gesture, true, but everything has a first step.
An unexpected benefit of my training. Any novice knows how to source the right herbs and mixtures to alter one's hair
Typically reserved for disguises and subterfuge rather than self-discovery, but I don't live by Shar's rules any longer.
I'm glad... though I don't think I'm quite done with the past yet. Not until I've been to Baldur's Gate.
Well, I'm glad someone does. Perhaps I'll get used to it. I have a lot to get used to, right now.
Honest of you - I can appreciate that, after being lied to by Shar for so long.
Give it time. It may grow on you.
Don't get your hopes up. I'm not exactly keen to throw my lot in with another goddess after what happened last time.
I... I think so, yes. Perhaps I shouldn't put it to the test, but compared to everyone else, I feel fine. Better than fine.
Do you know what this means? I must be blessed. Lady Shar is protecting me where others are left to face her wrath.
She loves me. She must do.
You're resourceful - you'll find a way. Don't give me that look. It's a good thing that I'm resistant to the shadows - this way I can help you.
Carried away? Hardly - the proof is right there. Just be grateful someone can handle this place.
Lady Shar wouldn't bless me like this for no reason - there must be something she wants of me.
Those signs we found, about Dark Justiciars... perhaps they were no coincidence. In either case, I need to watch for any place dedicated to Lady Shar. A temple, perhaps.
This isn't the first sign we've come across of a Sharran presence. I'm not sure I can keep ignoring them.
I need to watch for any place dedicated to Lady Shar. A temple, perhaps. I need to know if there's more to this.
Very reassuring, thank you.
Oh it's no hardship; he loves them - him and mother both. But we'll fetch him something, yes - some of his shirts are looking a little worn...
Oh, she's just protective of me - I give her a shoulder to perch on and all the nuts she can manage.
I wish I could see more of my parents, but we get by, and they're doing well for themselves. Perhaps one day both Wyll and I will be able to return for good.
... sorry, am I oversharing? I don't get much practice at polite conversation in that place, as I'm sure you can imagine.
At Wyll's side in Avernus of course - be it in the heat of battle or the heat of the bedroll...
It's not exactly the quiet life, but perhaps after all that happened, it's for the best if I keep busy. Still though, I hope Karlach and I can return for good some day.
But enough about me - what have you been doing?
Between you and me, I've pretended to have a sprained ankle now and again, for a ride on those muscles.
But until then, I'm glad to be by her side - or thrown over her shoulder on occasion, if the odds turn against us.
It's not exactly the quiet life, but perhaps after all that happened with my parents, it's for the best if I keep busy. Still though, I hope Karlach and I can return for good some day.
